Other dog parks in the area include Nay Aug Park (2.9 miles) and Connors Park (3.7 miles)—both great for exploring with your four-legged friend.

name: Connell Park
description: Scranton dog owners rate Connell Park at 800 Gibbons St highly, with 4.6 stars from 103 visits. The steady stream of dog owner visits speaks to the park's appeal. More dog-friendly parks nearby include Connors Park (1.4 miles) and Nay Aug Park (2.0 miles)—perfect for pups who love adventure.

name: Nay Aug Park
description: For Scranton dog owners, Nay Aug Park at 500 Arthur Ave has become a reliable favorite—4.5 stars from 3,547 reviews. Open from 7am to 8pm daily, dog owners have plenty of flexibility to visit when it suits their schedule. For variety, many dog owners also bring their furry friends to Connors Park (0.9 miles)—another great dog park in the area.

name: ‍ Connors Park
description: For dog owners in Scranton, Connors Park at 515 Orchard St has a 4.4-star rating (101 reviews). Open from 9am to 6pm daily, the park gives dog owners in the neighborhood time to bring their pups. Dog owners in the neighborhood can also take their furry friends to Nay Aug Park, 0.9 miles away.

name: Macclesfield Park
description: Dog owners in Yardley have made Macclesfield Park at 1000 River Rd a go-to spot, rating it 4.6 stars across 87 reviews. The park serves dog owners well, providing a destination the community values. Other dog parks in the area include Stacy Park (2.6 miles) and Banchoff Park (2.9 miles)—both great for exploring with your four-legged friend.
